name: Diode Forward Voltage
explanation: Diodes are semiconductor devices that allow current to flow in only one direction. When forward-biased (positive voltage on anode), a silicon diode has approximately 0.7V drop across it. When reverse-biased, it blocks current (except for tiny leakage). Diodes are used for rectification (converting AC to DC), protection, voltage regulation, and signal processing. LEDs are special diodes that emit light when forward-biased.

examples.problem: A 5V source powers a circuit through a silicon diode. What voltage reaches the circuit?
An LED with 2V forward voltage is powered by 9V through a 350Ω resistor. What current flows?
